Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2011 06:34PM grdnslve wrote: i got the letter saying my mammo was normal, then a call from the radiologist telling me he wanted me to disregard the letter as he just had a bad feeling & wanted me to get a bx.  i remember being a bit irritated, as i was so sure it was nothing.  the bx was a pain, as the us didn't clearly pick up the spot well, so there were many pokes.  but the path results were positive.  the bs wanted an mri of both breasts, the 'good' breast showed 'something', & the bc side showed two little areas.  had an us of the 'good' breast which didn't show anything, so went for an mri guided bx.  they couldn't find anything to bx.  we started going to the casino after every appt just to cope with the conflicting info.  i saw the mammos myself & there was nothing to 'see' in terms of changes, or clearly defined suspicious area.  i just thank God for a radiologist with a gut feeling.  surgery unearthed two 2cm tumors & one 6cm with lymph node involvement, and disease in surrounding tissue.  and no, we could not feel a lump.  the breast didn't feel any different than it ever did. i'm more angry about the asshole the premarital counselling didn't pick up & wasting those years.  but then just glad i got out of that before ending up in an ann rule book.  then i found the other half of my heart, so all is well. the mammos, us & mri were not perfect, but ultimately i was diagnosed & treated. kind of like winning the lottery twice.  well, if you throw in the brain tumor & the divorce from psycho, maybe that is four times.
Posts.Title: How could I go for yearly mammos and end up with a 6.5cm tumour? Cat123 scuttlers

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2011 03:30PM grdnslve wrote: a year ago i had a meltdown every time i got out of the shower & saw myself in the mirror.  but i had delayed diep reconstruction this year (just completed a month ago) and feel about as normal as possible.  i had looked forward to the recontruction, but had no idea it would turn out so well & make me feel so whole again.  i think the way you feel about yourself makes all the difference.  even though i was still the same person, just couldn't get over that physical hurdle before.  good luck to you...you are not alone in your feelings.

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2011 04:06PM grdnslve wrote: susansgarden--keeping the cami on was a lifesaver for me before the recon.  love your sig line.  years ago i got a card from someone that said 'i cried because i had no shoes, until i met a woman with no credit card'.  don't know why that cracked me up, but still remember it.  guess it's like rosanadana said 'it's always somethin'
